trans-unit.source: The preprocessor token '{0}' has been given more than one value. Choosing '{1}' as the value.
trans-unit.target: The preprocessor token '{0}' has been given more than one value. Choosing '{1}' as the value.

trans-unit.source: Assets file {0} couldn't be found. Run a NuGet package restore to generate this file.
trans-unit.target: Assets file {0} couldn't be found. Run a NuGet package restore to generate this file.

trans-unit.source: Lock file {0} couldn't be found. Run a NuGet package restore to generate this file.
trans-unit.target: Lock file {0} couldn't be found. Run a NuGet package restore to generate this file.

trans-unit.source: Your project does not reference "{0}" framework. Add a reference to "{0}" in the "TargetFrameworks" property of your project file and then re-run NuGet restore.
trans-unit.target: Your project does not reference "{0}" framework. Add a reference to "{0}" in the "TargetFrameworks" property of your project file and then re-run NuGet restore.

trans-unit.source: Your project does not reference "{0}" framework. Add a reference to "{0}" in the "frameworks" section of your project.json and then re-run NuGet restore.
trans-unit.target: Your project does not reference "{0}" framework. Add a reference to "{0}" in the "frameworks" section of your project.json and then re-run NuGet restore.

trans-unit.source: The package '{0}' could not be found in the libraries section of the lock file. This may indicate your lock file is corrupted.
trans-unit.target: The package '{0}' could not be found in the libraries section of the lock file. This may indicate your lock file is corrupted.

trans-unit.source: The package '{0}' could not be found in the libraries section of the assets file. This may indicate your assets file is corrupted.
trans-unit.target: The package '{0}' could not be found in the libraries section of the assets file. This may indicate your assets file is corrupted.

trans-unit.source: Your project file doesn't list '{0}' as a "RuntimeIdentifier". You should add '{1}' to the "RuntimeIdentifiers" property in your project file and then re-run NuGet restore.
trans-unit.target: Your project file doesn't list '{0}' as a "RuntimeIdentifier". You should add '{1}' to the "RuntimeIdentifiers" property in your project file and then re-run NuGet restore.

trans-unit.source: Your project file doesn't have the "RuntimeIdentifiers" property. You should add '{0}' to your project file and then re-run NuGet restore.
trans-unit.target: Your project file doesn't have the "RuntimeIdentifiers" property. You should add '{0}' to your project file and then re-run NuGet restore.

trans-unit.source: Your project.json doesn't list '{0}' as a "RuntimeIdentifier". You should add '{1}' inside your "runtimes" section in your project.json and then re-run NuGet restore.
trans-unit.target: Your project.json doesn't list '{0}' as a "RuntimeIdentifier". You should add '{1}' inside your "runtimes" section in your project.json and then re-run NuGet restore.

trans-unit.source: Your project.json doesn't have a runtimes section. You should add '{0}' to your project.json and then re-run NuGet restore.
trans-unit.target: Your project.json doesn't have a runtimes section. You should add '{0}' to your project.json and then re-run NuGet restore.

trans-unit.source: No targets could be found in the assets file. Make sure you have "RuntimeIdentifiers" property in your project file.
trans-unit.target: No targets could be found in the assets file. Make sure you have "RuntimeIdentifiers" property in your project file.

trans-unit.source: No targets could be found in the lock file. Make sure you have a supports or runtimes section in your project.json file.
trans-unit.target: No targets could be found in the lock file. Make sure you have a supports or runtimes section in your project.json file.

trans-unit.source: The package {0} with version {1} could not be found in {2}. Run a NuGet package restore to download the package.
trans-unit.target: The package {0} with version {1} could not be found in {2}. Run a NuGet package restore to download the package.
trans-unit.note: 0 - package id 1 - package version 2 - package folder path

trans-unit.source: The {0} property must be set in order to consume preprocessed content.
trans-unit.target: The {0} property must be set in order to consume preprocessed content.
